stories.title: Text Message Quality Gate
stories.description: Implement pre-processing validation for WhatsApp text messages to reject empty, too short, or gibberish content before expensive AI processing.
acceptanceCriteria: 4. Average word length: avgWordLength > 20 or < 2 → reject (gibberish detection)
Return type: { isValid: boolean, reason?: string, suggestion?: string }
Integration: Add validation to processIncomingMessage in actions/whatsapp.ts
Rejection flow: If !isValid, send suggestion to WhatsApp, mark message status='rejected', return early
- messageQualityCheck: v.optional(v.object({ isValid: v.boolean(), reason: v.optional(v.string()), checkedAt: v.number() }))
- 'John did well in training today' → accepted
Type check passes: npm run check-types
Manual WhatsApp test: Send 'hi' → receives rejection message

stories.title: Transcript Quality Validation
stories.description: Implement post-transcription quality validation to detect inaudible audio, gibberish transcripts, or poor-quality recordings before insight extraction.
acceptanceCriteria: Function: validateTranscriptQuality(transcript: string, audioDuration?: number): TranscriptQualityResult
Return type: { isValid: boolean, confidence: number, reason?: string, suggestedAction: 'process' | 'ask_user' | 'reject' }
2. Too short audio (<3s) + short transcript (<20 chars) → reject
- Count uncertainty markers, calc ratio: uncertaintyCount / wordCount
5. Average word length check: avgWordLength < 2 or > 15 → ask_user (confidence: 0.2)
- Keywords: player, team, training, match, game, injury, session, practice, coach, etc.
- Store transcriptQuality (0-1) and transcriptValidation in voiceNote
- If suggestedAction === 'reject' → mark insightsStatus='failed', don't process
- If suggestedAction === 'process' → continue to insight extraction
- transcriptValidation: v.optional(v.object({ isValid: v.boolean(), reason: v.optional(v.string()), suggestedAction: v.union(v.literal('process'), v.literal('ask_user'), v.literal('reject')) }))
- 'John did well in training' (sports context) → accepted (0.9)
- 'The weather is nice today' (no sports) → accepted (0.6)
Type check passes: npm run check-types
Manual test: Upload audio with background noise → receives quality feedback

stories.title: Duplicate Message Detection
stories.description: Detect and prevent processing of duplicate WhatsApp messages (accidental sends, network retries) to avoid wasted API calls and user confusion.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend: Create checkForDuplicateMessage query in models/whatsappMessages.ts
Query args: { phoneNumber: v.string(), body: v.optional(v.string()), mediaContentType: v.optional(v.string()), withinMinutes: v.optional(v.number()) }
1. Get recent messages from same phone within time window
2. For text: Check if body matches exactly
3. For audio: Check if mediaContentType matches + timeDiff < 2 minutes (network retry detection)
Return: { isDuplicate: boolean, originalMessageId: v.id('whatsappMessages'), timeSinceOriginal: v.number() } or null
Integration: Add to processIncomingMessage in actions/whatsapp.ts
- If isDuplicate: Send WhatsApp message: '⚠️ I just received a similar message X seconds ago. If this is a new note, please add more details so I can tell them apart.'
- Same text twice within 2 min → duplicate
- Same text after 6 min → not duplicate
- Different text within 2 min → not duplicate
- Audio with same type within 1 min → duplicate
Type check passes: npm run check-types
Manual test: Send same message twice quickly → second rejected as duplicate

stories.title: Enhanced WhatsApp Feedback Messages
stories.description: Replace generic error messages with specific, actionable feedback based on rejection reason (empty, too short, inaudible, etc.) to improve user experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Note: Extends existing generic fallbacks in checkAndAutoApply for edge cases
Backend: Create sendDetailedFeedback() function in actions/whatsapp.ts
Function signature: sendDetailedFeedback(phoneNumber: string, voiceNote: any, retryCount: number): Promise<void>

'❌ I couldn't transcribe your audio. This might be because:
• Audio was too short (needs 3+ seconds)
• Background noise was too loud
• File format issue

Please try recording again in a quiet space.'

'❌ {reason message}.

📝 Transcript: "{transcript.substring(0, 100)}"

Please try again:
• Record in a quiet place
• Speak clearly for at least 5 seconds
• Mention player names and what happened'
- empty_transcript: 'The audio had no speech detected.'
- too_short: 'The message was too short to analyze.'
- mostly_inaudible: 'Most of the audio was inaudible or noisy.'
- too_few_words: 'I only caught a few words.'
- suspicious_word_pattern: 'The transcription doesn't look like natural speech.'

'⚠️ I transcribed your audio, but I'm not confident about the quality.

📝 I heard: "{transcript.substring(0, 150)}"

Reply:
• CONFIRM to analyze it anyway
• RETRY to record again
• CANCEL to discard'

'❌ I transcribed your note but couldn't extract insights.

📝 Transcript: "{transcript.substring(0, 100)}"

This might be because:
• No player names were mentioned
• The message wasn't about player development

Your note is saved in the app. You can add details manually.'

'⏳ Your note is taking longer than usual to process.

You can:
• Check the app for updates
• Wait for processing to complete (may take 1-2 minutes)

If this keeps happening, please report it.'
Integration: Replace existing error messages in checkAndAutoApply
- Call sendDetailedFeedback for validation failures (adds to existing generic fallbacks)
- Use appropriate category based on status
- If user replies 'CONFIRM' to awaiting_confirmation message → mark as confirmed, process insights
- If user replies 'RETRY' → ignore previous note, allow new recording
- If user replies 'CANCEL' → mark as cancelled
- Mostly inaudible → correct rejection with transcript snippet
- No players mentioned → correct insights failed message
Type check passes: npm run check-types
Manual test: Trigger each rejection type → verify correct message received

stories.title: Levenshtein Fuzzy Matching Backend
stories.description: Implement Levenshtein distance algorithm for fuzzy player name matching to handle typos, Irish names, and phonetic variations (Seán vs Shawn, Niamh vs Neeve).
acceptanceCriteria: Function: levenshteinDistance(a: string, b: string): number
Function: levenshteinSimilarity(a: string, b: string): number
- Returns: 1 - (distance / maxLength)  // 0 = no match, 1 = exact match
- Edge cases: If a === b return 1, if either length === 0 return 0
- Lowercase, trim, remove diacritics (é → e, á → a, ó → o)
- Remove common prefixes: O', Mc, Mac
Performance test: Matching 1000 names completes in <100ms
Type check passes: npm run check-types

stories.title: Find Similar Players Query
stories.description: Implement findSimilarPlayers query using Levenshtein matching to suggest player candidates for unmatched names in voice notes, with team context and recent mentions weighting.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend: Add findSimilarPlayers query to models/orgPlayerEnrollments.ts
Query args: { organizationId: v.string(), coachUserId: v.string(), searchName: v.string(), limit: v.optional(v.number()) }

Query returns: v.array(v.object({ playerIdentityId: v.id('playerIdentities'), firstName: v.string(), lastName: v.string(), fullName: v.string(), teamName: v.optional(v.string()), ageGroup: v.optional(v.string()), similarity: v.number() }))
1. Get players from coach's teams: Call getPlayersForCoachTeamsInternal
- If player was mentioned in last 3 voice notes from same coach: similarity += 0.1
- If searchName includes team context (e.g., 'John from U14'): similarity += 0.15 for U14 players
Index optimization: Use by_org_and_status index for initial player fetch
- Limit works: limit=3 returns max 3 results
Type check passes: npm run check-types
Manual test: Query with known typo → returns correct player suggestions
